GATSBY

# 

<span key="51cd2cdda197499e9b7cd96e6ed5db27"><span offset-key="51cd2cdda197499e9b7cd96e6ed5db27:0">Gatsby</span></span>

<span key="9138f4b29e1643d982eef2152f42b20b"><span offset-key="9138f4b29e1643d982eef2152f42b20b:0">This guide will help you get started using Netlify CMS and Gatsby.</span></span>

<span key="4fe28ee09a00408b844c3d04ab492cc8"><span offset-key="4fe28ee09a00408b844c3d04ab492cc8:0">To get up and running with Gatsby, you’ll need to have </span></span><a href="https://nodejs.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5594ed6ef3844599a4a4c52acab5bc7b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="c1ab739913e64565b6ba17bdc80b622e"><span data-offset-key="c1ab739913e64565b6ba17bdc80b622e:0">Node.js</span></span></span></a><span key="6a25bc3f4e38424d91e978057bcc7508"><span offset-key="6a25bc3f4e38424d91e978057bcc7508:0"> installed on your computer. </span>*Note: Gatsby's minimum supported Node.js version is Node 8.*</span>

## 

<span key="a6d8a81907f74ae2b4044c330cde7bb0"><span offset-key="a6d8a81907f74ae2b4044c330cde7bb0:0">Create a new Gatsby site</span></span>

<span key="4743cce233544939a60093ef2c06860c"><span offset-key="4743cce233544939a60093ef2c06860c:0">Let's create a new site using the default Gatsby Starter Blog. Run the following commands in the terminal, in the folder where you'd like to create the blog:</span></span>

1

<span key="7ca6a99d36094533afe986f04e59825c"><span offset-key="7ca6a99d36094533afe986f04e59825c:0">npm install -g gatsby-cli</span></span>

2

<span key="bf30420ad0904194b3ef08bb4fb87382"><span offset-key="bf30420ad0904194b3ef08bb4fb87382:0">gatsby new blog https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby-starter-blog</span></span>

3

<span key="669f62349554489cbbd69dc1aa8999de"><span offset-key="669f62349554489cbbd69dc1aa8999de:0">cd blog</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

## 

<span key="e5cee873b40d484aa118a9f577c6851e"><span offset-key="e5cee873b40d484aa118a9f577c6851e:0">Get to know Gatsby</span></span>

<span key="77f76a4235844c14899586b0f2c25c0c"><span offset-key="77f76a4235844c14899586b0f2c25c0c:0">In your favorite code editor, open up the code generated for your "Gatsby Starter Blog" site, and take a look at the </span>`content`<span offset-key="77f76a4235844c14899586b0f2c25c0c:2"> directory.</span></span>

<span key="9f81c89901ba43759769d27f4023cd1f"><span offset-key="9f81c89901ba43759769d27f4023cd1f:0">You will see that there are multiple Markdown files that represent blog posts. Open one </span>`.md`<span offset-key="9f81c89901ba43759769d27f4023cd1f:2"> file and you will see something like this:</span></span>

1

<span key="d32b862ff2ad49b088f74f01fe761062"><span offset-key="d32b862ff2ad49b088f74f01fe761062:0">---</span></span>

2

<span key="8e4238895d84443497b8b74381c2292a"><span offset-key="8e4238895d84443497b8b74381c2292a:0">title: New Beginnings</span></span>

3

<span key="84b763151a8e4731a86c4f5a5bfbadba"><span offset-key="84b763151a8e4731a86c4f5a5bfbadba:0">date: "2015-05-28T22:40:32.169Z"</span></span>

4

<span key="24832e794d7c408b8b109a8d707f6b37"><span offset-key="24832e794d7c408b8b109a8d707f6b37:0">description: This is an optional description for SEO and Open Graph purposes, rather than the default generated excerpt.</span></span>

5

<span key="8178a58c31164b438ef0de1885e893a0"><span offset-key="8178a58c31164b438ef0de1885e893a0:0">---</span></span>

6

<span key="113fc21bb1904c6fa6177db286b74dbe"><span offset-key="113fc21bb1904c6fa6177db286b74dbe:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

7

<span key="6ab59055b8da4868af6a0ffc631a2370"><span offset-key="6ab59055b8da4868af6a0ffc631a2370:0">Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and</span></span>

8

<span key="379e3f62bd3340ca84e5d1f16a03bc45"><span offset-key="379e3f62bd3340ca84e5d1f16a03bc45:0">Consonantia, there live the blind texts.</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="566e6b97d3754225b71e0c875ae0d692"><span offset-key="566e6b97d3754225b71e0c875ae0d692:0">We can see above that each blog post has a title, a date, a description and a body. Now, let's recreate this using Netlify CMS.</span></span>

## 

<span key="d7e7632bb29549579dc62b5950f646f4"><span offset-key="d7e7632bb29549579dc62b5950f646f4:0">Add Netlify CMS to your site</span></span>

<span key="64de781881424223995b23bad39de7bb"><span offset-key="64de781881424223995b23bad39de7bb:0">First let's install some dependencies. We'll need </span>`netlify-cms-app`<span offset-key="64de781881424223995b23bad39de7bb:2"> and </span>`gatsby-plugin-netlify-cms`<span offset-key="64de781881424223995b23bad39de7bb:4">. Run the following command in the terminal at the root of your site:</span></span>

1

<span key="86fae4eabbff4773a692549a00f857a2"><span offset-key="86fae4eabbff4773a692549a00f857a2:0">npm install --save netlify-cms-app gatsby-plugin-netlify-cms</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

### 

<span key="0c06dfd03bfb40c4a05d4d245813c112"><span offset-key="0c06dfd03bfb40c4a05d4d245813c112:0">Configuration</span></span>

<span key="05e21763b8f54ce89ae71fdbdf71d619"><span offset-key="05e21763b8f54ce89ae71fdbdf71d619:0">For the purpose of this guide we will deploy to Netlify from a GitHub repository which requires the minimum configuration.</span></span>

<span key="4c9186bf1bcc47cc8e82987f5f3a7e77"><span offset-key="4c9186bf1bcc47cc8e82987f5f3a7e77:0">Create a </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="4c9186bf1bcc47cc8e82987f5f3a7e77:2"> file in the directory structure you see below:</span></span>

1

<span key="de2664bfa3344e10ac2858db72287b15"><span offset-key="de2664bfa3344e10ac2858db72287b15:0">├── static</span></span>

2

<span key="5dd034da398a47b0879e71ef75ca9f0e"><span offset-key="5dd034da398a47b0879e71ef75ca9f0e:0">│ ├── admin</span></span>

3

<span key="c6c78a7fd053415e9bf191a2587132fd"><span offset-key="c6c78a7fd053415e9bf191a2587132fd:0">│ │ ├── config.yml</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="6cde483fd9914241846bde37fae2a41e"><span offset-key="6cde483fd9914241846bde37fae2a41e:0">In your </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="6cde483fd9914241846bde37fae2a41e:2"> file paste the following configuration:</span></span>

1

<span key="8a8df53ebd664562b53bd1411db32a14"><span offset-key="8a8df53ebd664562b53bd1411db32a14:0">backend:</span></span>

2

<span key="452523bbedbb44aabea0efafa035ee1d"><span offset-key="452523bbedbb44aabea0efafa035ee1d:0"> name: git-gateway</span></span>

3

<span key="d3f11d1dad8943ab8c16f4b4483a3c28"><span offset-key="d3f11d1dad8943ab8c16f4b4483a3c28:0"> branch: main # Branch to update (optional; defaults to master)</span></span>

4

<span key="848c43d6402e4ecaa91b45b4d6b16268"><span offset-key="848c43d6402e4ecaa91b45b4d6b16268:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

5

<span key="43bde372dbf547bda921da2cda5d918c"><span offset-key="43bde372dbf547bda921da2cda5d918c:0">media\_folder: static/img</span></span>

6

<span key="597abafdf21d4ba0ad48d15de9431c5e"><span offset-key="597abafdf21d4ba0ad48d15de9431c5e:0">public\_folder: /img</span></span>

7

<span key="dc2c96a8fef44f708bbbf4d047e84c68"><span offset-key="dc2c96a8fef44f708bbbf4d047e84c68:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

8

<span key="b00703cf57d44dab9cda0014fe233bc9"><span offset-key="b00703cf57d44dab9cda0014fe233bc9:0">collections:</span></span>

9

<span key="a5b6c30564554f49b5d67bffd81bda00"><span offset-key="a5b6c30564554f49b5d67bffd81bda00:0"> - name: 'blog'</span></span>

10

<span key="94be17c05679467bb1c22c6a1916c71d"><span offset-key="94be17c05679467bb1c22c6a1916c71d:0"> label: 'Blog'</span></span>

11

<span key="4cae8527f9d04883bba6f3e84228774a"><span offset-key="4cae8527f9d04883bba6f3e84228774a:0"> folder: 'content/blog'</span></span>

12

<span key="a992a1f4d8534b3d837199ed966829af"><span offset-key="a992a1f4d8534b3d837199ed966829af:0"> create: true</span></span>

13

<span key="2211a20f71fe4333ae9e7ce6460e218d"><span offset-key="2211a20f71fe4333ae9e7ce6460e218d:0"> slug: 'index'</span></span>

14

<span key="560b7a1590ce4eefb33141e7ed353df4"><span offset-key="560b7a1590ce4eefb33141e7ed353df4:0"> media\_folder: ''</span></span>

15

<span key="3c5bdd7f2951426ebab81f756bd6b56f"><span offset-key="3c5bdd7f2951426ebab81f756bd6b56f:0"> public\_folder: ''</span></span>

16

<span key="69cbf8b8303847f08d1fe0b097372a50"><span offset-key="69cbf8b8303847f08d1fe0b097372a50:0"> path: '{{title}}/index'</span></span>

17

<span key="13e332b2e7014bcf8fdeba7b82216c80"><span offset-key="13e332b2e7014bcf8fdeba7b82216c80:0"> editor:</span></span>

18

<span key="377f5256747f40b7864ea0ff500a3eab"><span offset-key="377f5256747f40b7864ea0ff500a3eab:0"> preview: false</span></span>

19

<span key="79df370b4fd94492b83bf72eb65fda05"><span offset-key="79df370b4fd94492b83bf72eb65fda05:0"> fields:</span></span>

20

<span key="df7a397766144a2c91ecc3373d777cc1"><span offset-key="df7a397766144a2c91ecc3373d777cc1:0"> - { label: 'Title', name: 'title', widget: 'string' }</span></span>

21

<span key="6d8ab7d659824765818da9f42eecf022"><span offset-key="6d8ab7d659824765818da9f42eecf022:0"> - { label: 'Publish Date', name: 'date', widget: 'datetime' }</span></span>

22

<span key="164afebb00244d2da9a482b2a6cd0080"><span offset-key="164afebb00244d2da9a482b2a6cd0080:0"> - { label: 'Description', name: 'description', widget: 'string' }</span></span>

23

<span key="3f2ebad755ff4ea3933d0dea2275ff39"><span offset-key="3f2ebad755ff4ea3933d0dea2275ff39:0"> - { label: 'Body', name: 'body', widget: 'markdown' }</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="be0604f99dc54b2cb4ce9bbfc8e477c3">**Note:**<span offset-key="be0604f99dc54b2cb4ce9bbfc8e477c3:1"> The above configuration allows assets to be stored relative to their content. Therefore posts would be stored in the format below as it is in </span>`gatsby-starter-blog`<span offset-key="be0604f99dc54b2cb4ce9bbfc8e477c3:3">.</span></span>

1

<span key="d5d2c2f2354c431f9632badf555ed40a"><span offset-key="d5d2c2f2354c431f9632badf555ed40a:0">content/</span></span>

2

<span key="952c81cc9cb449ce8e024a03b85d867a"><span offset-key="952c81cc9cb449ce8e024a03b85d867a:0">├── blog</span></span>

3

<span key="b32e65e9288043a7acda56a8124eb6cc"><span offset-key="b32e65e9288043a7acda56a8124eb6cc:0">│ ├── first-post-title</span></span>

4

<span key="e1fe0b241d4844e1a895d5e56a189ca0"><span offset-key="e1fe0b241d4844e1a895d5e56a189ca0:0">│ │ ├── index.md</span></span>

5

<span key="4662512f708f485f8c47559b01642cc2"><span offset-key="4662512f708f485f8c47559b01642cc2:0">│ │ └── post-image.jpg</span></span>

6

<span key="50056c9e99684a54a5a7f2cfe518b87c"><span offset-key="50056c9e99684a54a5a7f2cfe518b87c:0">└── └── second-post-title</span></span>

7

<span key="f7150ac7400341518409a788c5a61fe6"><span offset-key="f7150ac7400341518409a788c5a61fe6:0"> ├── index.md</span></span>

8

<span key="d8369991f3d946b9892c778f6e16df8b"><span offset-key="d8369991f3d946b9892c778f6e16df8b:0"> └── post-image.jpg</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="8bfdd78618384e3fb3386de48312744a"><span offset-key="8bfdd78618384e3fb3386de48312744a:0">Finally, add the plugin to your </span>`gatsby-config.js`<span offset-key="8bfdd78618384e3fb3386de48312744a:2">.</span></span>

1

<span key="c873175f852a4ed2b3b32d2b4d254621"><span offset-key="c873175f852a4ed2b3b32d2b4d254621:0">plugins: \[\`gatsby-plugin-netlify-cms\`\]</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

### 

<span key="26463394b85c4aad934917301959c891"><span offset-key="26463394b85c4aad934917301959c891:0">Push to GitHub</span></span>

<span key="34f8a84d214b411abbe611babb3df229"><span offset-key="34f8a84d214b411abbe611babb3df229:0">It's now time to commit your changes and push to GitHub. The Gatsby starter initializes Git automatically for you, so you only need to do:</span></span>

1

<span key="161b28764d104ce7bafa2b72aa36f7d3"><span offset-key="161b28764d104ce7bafa2b72aa36f7d3:0">git add .</span></span>

2

<span key="839e5da00131463abbd0a16865a75140"><span offset-key="839e5da00131463abbd0a16865a75140:0">git commit -m "Initial Commit"</span></span>

3

<span key="7caafaf4e8cc47749cd629e17f80b682"><span offset-key="7caafaf4e8cc47749cd629e17f80b682:0">git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR\_USERNAME/NEW\_REPO\_NAME.git</span></span>

4

<span key="522c51edf4b54ef58ba9229dea3074f1"><span offset-key="522c51edf4b54ef58ba9229dea3074f1:0">git push -u origin main</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

### 

<span key="9f10196cc3894ada9bf464e071368491"><span offset-key="9f10196cc3894ada9bf464e071368491:0">Add your repo to Netlify</span></span>

<span key="4df4b208df4842228d00b8e25d91d05b"><span offset-key="4df4b208df4842228d00b8e25d91d05b:0">Go to Netlify and select 'New Site from Git'. Select GitHub and the repository you just pushed to. Click Configure Netlify on GitHub and give access to your repository. Finish the setup by clicking Deploy Site. Netlify will begin reading your repository and starting building your project.</span></span>

### 

<span key="9768ea5948dd4ecbbadb1c32ea4e53c7"><span offset-key="9768ea5948dd4ecbbadb1c32ea4e53c7:0">Enable Identity and Git Gateway</span></span>

<span key="fba772f979cd4f2784c382e3fe5ab4c2"><span offset-key="fba772f979cd4f2784c382e3fe5ab4c2:0">Netlify's Identity and Git Gateway services allow you to manage CMS admin users for your site without requiring them to have an account with your Git host or commit access on your repo. From your site dashboard on Netlify:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="c609db59fe5f42e9979bed547c7101d7"><span offset-key="c609db59fe5f42e9979bed547c7101d7:0">Go to </span>**Settings > Identity**<span offset-key="c609db59fe5f42e9979bed547c7101d7:2">, and select </span>**Enable Identity service**<span offset-key="c609db59fe5f42e9979bed547c7101d7:4">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="6e701bbde2794d61b081d7dccff7be9e"><span offset-key="6e701bbde2794d61b081d7dccff7be9e:0">Under </span>**Registration preferences**<span offset-key="6e701bbde2794d61b081d7dccff7be9e:2">, select </span>**Open**<span offset-key="6e701bbde2794d61b081d7dccff7be9e:4"> or </span>**Invite only**<span offset-key="6e701bbde2794d61b081d7dccff7be9e:6">. In most cases, you want only invited users to access your CMS, but if you're just experimenting, you can leave it open for convenience.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="39002685e0bc4e61899e3820aedc99e9"><span offset-key="39002685e0bc4e61899e3820aedc99e9:0">If you'd like to allow one-click login with services like Google and GitHub, check the boxes next to the services you'd like to use, under </span>**External providers**<span offset-key="39002685e0bc4e61899e3820aedc99e9:2">.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">4.</span>
    <span key="110743ddc896422b84b6071524af91a4"><span offset-key="110743ddc896422b84b6071524af91a4:0">Scroll down to </span>**Services > Git Gateway**<span offset-key="110743ddc896422b84b6071524af91a4:2">, and click </span>**Enable Git Gateway**<span offset-key="110743ddc896422b84b6071524af91a4:4">. This authenticates with your Git host and generates an API access token. In this case, we're leaving the </span>**Roles**<span offset-key="110743ddc896422b84b6071524af91a4:6"> field blank, which means any logged in user may access the CMS. For information on changing this, check the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/docs/identity/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="921534756fca4fdca558472c485f9cf8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="c5349443e6aa4e1081f2c6d6eab39873"><span data-offset-key="c5349443e6aa4e1081f2c6d6eab39873:0">Netlify Identity documentation</span></span></span></a><span key="fad9f4e0094e4bf49a1c3eacbd621e75"><span offset-key="fad9f4e0094e4bf49a1c3eacbd621e75:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="da82967f988e41748c7e1b4763616abb"><span offset-key="da82967f988e41748c7e1b4763616abb:0">Start publishing</span></span>

<span key="a5de84adf0e342c6856630f21cfbf9e7"><span offset-key="a5de84adf0e342c6856630f21cfbf9e7:0">It's time to create your first blog post. Login to your site's </span>`/admin/`<span offset-key="a5de84adf0e342c6856630f21cfbf9e7:2"> page and create a new post by clicking New Blog. Add a title, a date and some text. When you click Publish, a new commit will be created in your GitHub repo with this format </span>`Create Blog                                           “year-month-date-title”`<span offset-key="a5de84adf0e342c6856630f21cfbf9e7:4">.</span></span>

<span key="c64155542eb34d1ea77ee7be7baba72a"><span offset-key="c64155542eb34d1ea77ee7be7baba72a:0">Then Netlify will detect that there was a commit in your repo, and will start rebuilding your project. When your project is deployed you'll be able to see the post you created.</span></span>

### 

<span key="01564a515de14118bf8ed33c2fe78288"><span offset-key="01564a515de14118bf8ed33c2fe78288:0">Cleanup</span></span>

<span key="adb240ef2a744f54b483cd2ee11e72e0"><span offset-key="adb240ef2a744f54b483cd2ee11e72e0:0">It is now safe to remove the default Gatsby blog posts.</span></span>

## 

<span key="2025632374f94ed280d6c59f41e865c9"><span offset-key="2025632374f94ed280d6c59f41e865c9:0">EXAMPLES</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e3d92710923740c6ba4e7ab1ef4ca80d"><span offset-key="e3d92710923740c6ba4e7ab1ef4ca80d:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby/tree/master/examples/using-reach-skip-nav" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="4c5a53abc8ec46f1980052adb22bf167" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="cdaf210039664c6fb2f305281c61997a"><span data-offset-key="cdaf210039664c6fb2f305281c61997a:0">Using react-skip-nav</span></span></span></a><span key="1a61e6e8da39429fa00dafc21b92f7a9"><span offset-key="1a61e6e8da39429fa00dafc21b92f7a9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="522947c86e5448b78b9c3f8cb777cc50"><span offset-key="522947c86e5448b78b9c3f8cb777cc50:0">The Gatsby team is passionate about helping you create websites that work for everyone, with helpful defaults that bake in web accessibility as well as performance optimizations. By making your website accessible to people with disabilities, you can make more inclusive sites that reach and remove barriers for more people on the Internet.</span></span>

## 

<span key="802f44fa0ef44748be8b29718a1eef56"><span offset-key="802f44fa0ef44748be8b29718a1eef56:0">What is web accessibility?</span></span>

<span key="07689ff98b9a410d96847f7eb87208db"><span offset-key="07689ff98b9a410d96847f7eb87208db:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/fundamentals/accessibility-intro/#what" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="da092dbcb192403fb244c2b9d4c11856" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="21ce6cd468054b9eb6d5f48ab934eafa"><span data-offset-key="21ce6cd468054b9eb6d5f48ab934eafa:0">Web accessibility</span></span></span></a><span key="530866e94e4c44a8a144f879d0028da4"><span offset-key="530866e94e4c44a8a144f879d0028da4:0"> means that websites, tools, and technologies are designed and developed so that people with disabilities can use them. But not only people with permanent disabilities benefit from it. Accessibility also benefits people with temporary disabilities. For example, imagine being in an environment where you cannot listen to audio or you can’t use a computer because of a broken arm.</span></span>

<span key="e00476fee4af4e3e94b3696f909cb82e"><span offset-key="e00476fee4af4e3e94b3696f909cb82e:0">Back in the early days of the Web, Tim Berners-Lee, inventor of the World Wide Web, </span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/Press/IPO-announce" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="eeb03ef25405442c80e3468e8fd8ef22" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="32d4c4a2b58c458ca6c521116d6f476c"><span data-offset-key="32d4c4a2b58c458ca6c521116d6f476c:0">said</span></span></span></a><span key="5409cf2c21954c0d84a4baa27e9b1421"><span offset-key="5409cf2c21954c0d84a4baa27e9b1421:0">:</span></span>

> <span key="1d267559baa448e7a148c578e2a5e038"><span offset-key="1d267559baa448e7a148c578e2a5e038:0">“The power of the Web is in its universality. Access by everyone regardless of disability is an essential aspect.”</span></span>

<span key="5a74c41485044545b9f50672ac214b11"><span offset-key="5a74c41485044545b9f50672ac214b11:0">The web of today is an important resource in many aspects of life such as health care, education, or commerce. Accessibility is an important consideration when building for the web.</span></span>

<span key="2e7f75f625a446c8acaf16807827f799"><span offset-key="2e7f75f625a446c8acaf16807827f799:0">Accessibility supports </span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/standards/webdesign/accessibility#case" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5cb64a1be19e4c98876bffb7d3c822e0" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="80302907e7224af39479af4e60746ba8"><span data-offset-key="80302907e7224af39479af4e60746ba8:0">social inclusion for everyone</span></span></span></a><span key="f35243d567874cc0ab32181747ce90cf"><span offset-key="f35243d567874cc0ab32181747ce90cf:0">, and has a strong </span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/business-case/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="81830535632b4d9e93ee38f246d6d6d2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="89dc637ff7c54acabda80ef65a001523"><span data-offset-key="89dc637ff7c54acabda80ef65a001523:0">business case</span></span></span></a><span key="be05b6276d834756b836be8d7b9dc5be"><span offset-key="be05b6276d834756b836be8d7b9dc5be:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="2102d2485394433993f2c7de1c2d7d27"><span offset-key="2102d2485394433993f2c7de1c2d7d27:0">Gatsby makes accessibility easier</span></span>

<span key="18c1b9144df348cdb1935db9ec227825"><span offset-key="18c1b9144df348cdb1935db9ec227825:0">While ultimately it’s up to you to develop your site with accessibility in mind, Gatsby aims to provide as much out-of-the-box support as possible.</span></span>

### 

<span key="7507ae0551ee4dc4a7c5c1634de780ba"><span offset-key="7507ae0551ee4dc4a7c5c1634de780ba:0">Accessible routing</span></span>

<span key="ec3a22fbfa2f411281e12ca4b0c65426"><span offset-key="ec3a22fbfa2f411281e12ca4b0c65426:0">One of the most common features of every site is navigation. People should be able to navigate across your pages and content in an intuitive and accessible way.</span></span>

<span key="44e33ddb1ad7456baf7b969390ce6ae2"><span offset-key="44e33ddb1ad7456baf7b969390ce6ae2:0">That’s why every Gatsby site aims to have an accessible navigation experience by default. Thanks to </span></span><a href="https://reach.tech/router" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9c79b951c7bb4322917f36f77a202359" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="2917131db910480b8eb6f5b3164d109c"><span data-offset-key="2917131db910480b8eb6f5b3164d109c:0">@reach/router</span></span></span></a><span key="5077be5949c841dea6fe8cfec1b4591b"><span offset-key="5077be5949c841dea6fe8cfec1b4591b:0">, a routing library for React, Gatsby handles page announcements for screen readers on page change. We’re actively making improvements to this experience, and we </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/accessibility-statement/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b07617d32a7e40c9be4773224c2bd7f7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="d4cdce1ade654c94af36eae2ffdfa21d"><span data-offset-key="d4cdce1ade654c94af36eae2ffdfa21d:0">welcome your feedback</span></span></span></a><span key="22f3d6e801774af6ad305273ac766c33"><span offset-key="22f3d6e801774af6ad305273ac766c33:0">.</span></span>

<span key="428f46fbd05f42f5b8ad4496d1dea4b6"><span offset-key="428f46fbd05f42f5b8ad4496d1dea4b6:0">Since the </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/2018-09-17-gatsby-v2/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9edd90d24f004d4bb0d8d98baa417dfa" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="aba7a6c9dbea4fb5bf745fed6a8cda01"><span data-offset-key="aba7a6c9dbea4fb5bf745fed6a8cda01:0">second major release</span></span></span></a><span key="b42456f9dc4742c6b199e7f58f09315a"><span offset-key="b42456f9dc4742c6b199e7f58f09315a:0">, your Gatsby sites use </span>`@reach/router`<span offset-key="b42456f9dc4742c6b199e7f58f09315a:2"> under the hood. While additional accessibility testing is always a good idea, the </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/reference/built-in-components/gatsby-link/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="55e1ce1e8ac6452785b6d277c8cc1d93" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="3be61c22346b421d9cf3bfa706471c4a"><span data-offset-key="3be61c22346b421d9cf3bfa706471c4a:0">Gatsby Link Component</span></span></span></a><span key="a7b7f2198aa94b12bfa1925de8933c36"><span offset-key="a7b7f2198aa94b12bfa1925de8933c36:0"> wraps </span></span><a href="https://reach.tech/router/api/Link" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3b1eb722bd1f44cbb65555f2b674953a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="32989e00af09422384324bca1788b32d"><span data-offset-key="32989e00af09422384324bca1788b32d:0">@reach/router’s Link component</span></span></span></a><span key="8fdaf2b8b6444777a76176eccfe4969c"><span offset-key="8fdaf2b8b6444777a76176eccfe4969c:0"> to improve accessibility without you having to think about it. </span>`@reach/router`<span offset-key="8fdaf2b8b6444777a76176eccfe4969c:2"> also supports </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/how-to/routing/scroll-restoration" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a93a44cef53e420aa60f9049f1f941c6" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="5125b83a509a43198eb8f356a968fdb1"><span data-offset-key="5125b83a509a43198eb8f356a968fdb1:0">scroll restoration</span></span></span></a><span key="4b57cd62243b43b295ec53bdc46306b4"><span offset-key="4b57cd62243b43b295ec53bdc46306b4:0">.</span></span>

### 

<span key="564101b32ed74eba9e7c28634eb6df01"><span offset-key="564101b32ed74eba9e7c28634eb6df01:0">Gatsby builds HTML pages by default</span></span>

<span key="1a270d3614dc46409d1f0456080d47dc"><span offset-key="1a270d3614dc46409d1f0456080d47dc:0">For websites, rendering </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/glossary#static" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b77e657899e04111a2b3491ab04de140" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="a6ab4d461e694cce964fba999c6c6c3d"><span data-offset-key="a6ab4d461e694cce964fba999c6c6c3d:0">static HTML</span></span></span></a><span key="4ce825b516394947814b712ebc410283"><span offset-key="4ce825b516394947814b712ebc410283:0"> pages means that JavaScript isn’t required to access and navigate through content. Gatsby </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/glossary#compiler" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7cd5021cb2cf4e91972a19c76b99326c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="35442049c11144b199e33df35d2574f9"><span data-offset-key="35442049c11144b199e33df35d2574f9:0">compiles</span></span></span></a><span key="a00d56c949e74b118de424eed007bf43"><span offset-key="a00d56c949e74b118de424eed007bf43:0"> HTML pages by default from React components using </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/glossary#nodejs" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e15e06e186ff445a85e534b83b8b274f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="43c898529c7a45d4a915a3db1c386b7b"><span data-offset-key="43c898529c7a45d4a915a3db1c386b7b:0">Node.js</span></span></span></a><span key="11b17cdf79864f1289823463768db9de"><span offset-key="11b17cdf79864f1289823463768db9de:0">, meaning you don’t have to worry about setting up server-rendering yourself to support </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/glossary#progressive-enhancement" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="4dd5a658eeb4402f85027cf5acfeb256" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="5bcc56752eb041fd80e6c6b4f3875529"><span data-offset-key="5bcc56752eb041fd80e6c6b4f3875529:0">progressive enhancement</span></span></span></a><span key="f2e3f6b779b1432585cf8a6fcbae7b9a"><span offset-key="f2e3f6b779b1432585cf8a6fcbae7b9a:0">. With Gatsby’s static support out of the box, you can build dynamic sites that still enable user access without requiring </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/glossary#client-side" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7860ed58378840a5aa491b435a50949f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="c476762908414176be7fbcc58ee5dcf4"><span data-offset-key="c476762908414176be7fbcc58ee5dcf4:0">client-side</span></span></span></a><span key="307d2a9f7cd849bca84851ee01ac7540"><span offset-key="307d2a9f7cd849bca84851ee01ac7540:0"> scripting.</span></span>

### 

<span key="ba76a0a5b0484d5c8a00583ae8a56bb1"><span offset-key="ba76a0a5b0484d5c8a00583ae8a56bb1:0">Linting with eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y</span></span>

<span key="b8051c17bb6f41aca6e70f901b809b38"><span offset-key="b8051c17bb6f41aca6e70f901b809b38:0">Gatsby ships with the </span>`eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y`<span offset-key="b8051c17bb6f41aca6e70f901b809b38:2"> package and warnings for all of its rules enabled by default. </span></span><a href="https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f2d16f5b943a4e9c8acbcd8ea6a2b6e9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="aa0ad6aa05884e368b0fe687520b093d"><span data-offset-key="aa0ad6aa05884e368b0fe687520b093d:0">eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y</span></span></span></a><span key="5a5e8aa284364919b388e7c3259f0644"><span offset-key="5a5e8aa284364919b388e7c3259f0644:0"> is an accessibility </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/glossary#linting" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a4ded6a7a81642d4b1b3e2b624d95227" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="ee7219c9430a417aaf680ca7f4750d8e"><span data-offset-key="ee7219c9430a417aaf680ca7f4750d8e:0">linting</span></span></span></a><span key="0bdd28a6c98a4548a9a38190d5e8eaeb"><span offset-key="0bdd28a6c98a4548a9a38190d5e8eaeb:0"> tool for your code, helping you develop more inclusive Gatsby projects by reducing the time to find accessibility errors. This plugin encourages you to include alternative text for image tags, validates </span></span><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8d8ee9252e944c159f43303bea513844" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="490cfde6e0124d0f82edcbedfa84cec5"><span data-offset-key="490cfde6e0124d0f82edcbedfa84cec5:0">ARIA</span></span></span></a><span key="25c4e79892fe4957951c1e4f59310834"><span offset-key="25c4e79892fe4957951c1e4f59310834:0"> props, and eliminates redundant role properties, among other things.</span></span>

<span key="a1709d08b49d47398c7d3f4432f4cb5c"><span offset-key="a1709d08b49d47398c7d3f4432f4cb5c:0">For more on supported rules, check out the docs for </span></span><a href="https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f7e4e52783ac4c7eb8cb2370372ab2d1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="945282e7e9b94304b6d5979cd8578b72"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="945282e7e9b94304b6d5979cd8578b72:0">eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y</code></span></span></a><span key="61a3ac8e786b490eae567171ab2e1984"><span offset-key="61a3ac8e786b490eae567171ab2e1984:0">. You can customize those rules in your </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/how-to/custom-configuration/eslint/#configuring-eslint" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="de7493efcf21412ab10f7d4ef80b3c75" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="eef8c623bf324bbe850084c0e0c7c753"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="eef8c623bf324bbe850084c0e0c7c753:0">.eslintrc</code></span></span></a><span key="b8d4e19fe51e450ea4ad8d4bcdaa1614"><span offset-key="b8d4e19fe51e450ea4ad8d4bcdaa1614:0">..eslintrc</span></span>

1

<span key="a83591e1b7464cdd942f4eb06c3fb4fb"><span offset-key="a83591e1b7464cdd942f4eb06c3fb4fb:0">Copy.eslintrc: copy code to clipboard{ "extends": \["react-app", "plugin:jsx-a11y/recommended"\], "plugins": \["jsx-a11y"\], "rules": { "jsx-a11y/rule-name": "warn" }}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="fc22e5721fb841b3ba13d6ea1f5fa398"><span offset-key="fc22e5721fb841b3ba13d6ea1f5fa398:0">Note: Including a local </span>`.eslintrc`<span offset-key="fc22e5721fb841b3ba13d6ea1f5fa398:2"> file will </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/how-to/custom-configuration/eslint/#configuring-eslint" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="907261528f7c463eaa7bd7b2d9145212" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="3efa3113d4884a538c0e2d39f4ab7919"><span data-offset-key="3efa3113d4884a538c0e2d39f4ab7919:0">override</span></span></span></a><span key="a1db692fde6e400fbd30a4fcae0e0800"><span offset-key="a1db692fde6e400fbd30a4fcae0e0800:0"> all of Gatsby’s default linting and disable the built-in </span>`eslint-loader`<span offset-key="a1db692fde6e400fbd30a4fcae0e0800:2">, meaning your tweaked rules won’t make it to your browser’s developer console or your terminal window but will still be displayed if you have ESLint plugins enabled in your IDE. If you would like to change this behavior and make sure the </span>`eslint-loader`<span offset-key="a1db692fde6e400fbd30a4fcae0e0800:4"> pulls in your customizations, you’ll need to enable the loader yourself. One way to do this is by using the Community plugin </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/plugins/gatsby-plugin-eslint/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="27feaa5896724a4993f7c00799330838" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="7eb75c601b30464db8965ed60cf6fce1"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="7eb75c601b30464db8965ed60cf6fce1:0">gatsby-plugin-eslint</code></span></span></a><span key="94f957dcf58746f88fd26470b475a360"><span offset-key="94f957dcf58746f88fd26470b475a360:0">. Additionally, if you would still like to take advantage of some subset of the default </span></span><a href="https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby/blob/master/packages/gatsby/src/utils/eslint-config.ts" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="83133a77b2564372a823ce81945266fa" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="26d79673db7b455880da6a73e0535b35"><span data-offset-key="26d79673db7b455880da6a73e0535b35:0">ESLint config Gatsby ships with</span></span></span></a><span key="8e0e3fcabde54216afe0e782e920a027"><span offset-key="8e0e3fcabde54216afe0e782e920a027:0">, you’ll need to copy them manually to your local </span>`.eslintrc`<span offset-key="8e0e3fcabde54216afe0e782e920a027:2"> file.</span></span>

<span key="9e501a0173a9421cbfa56f510d9f8165"><span offset-key="9e501a0173a9421cbfa56f510d9f8165:0">This is a start to testing for accessibility: </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/conceptual/making-your-site-accessible/#how-to-improve-accessibility" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0fb5e69bab744aceabfca17a4e41fb98" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="2c343fb0197b442ebda85b17d6ce1e51"><span data-offset-key="2c343fb0197b442ebda85b17d6ce1e51:0">further recommendations</span></span></span></a><span key="76b1b7099f444620b2a3f218bb573a6d"><span offset-key="76b1b7099f444620b2a3f218bb573a6d:0"> can be found below.</span></span>

## 

<span key="7da5a70c2614419982bda5fe2727face"><span offset-key="7da5a70c2614419982bda5fe2727face:0">Tips for improving web accessibility</span></span>

<span key="e40dd944d23943cc84930baf295e2d8d"><span offset-key="e40dd944d23943cc84930baf295e2d8d:0">Accessibility by default is a win for everyone. Here’s a starting point for accessibility testing when making a Gatsby site or theme:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c074dbf2109141d4a0aed33cfacca91e"><span offset-key="c074dbf2109141d4a0aed33cfacca91e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a3728c1cea4043cbb6d49db31e0fcd71" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="07b1f478c9bc4b19a3dfe58aace39f85"><span data-offset-key="07b1f478c9bc4b19a3dfe58aace39f85:0">Use your keyboard</span></span></span></a><span key="a38a55e628ad42c789a8a2d46f416302"><span offset-key="a38a55e628ad42c789a8a2d46f416302:0"> to tab through the pages. Can you reach and operate every interactive control (links, buttons, form inputs, etc.) and see a focus indicator on the screen?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="63fc815e15684d76a81cbba80c9e27c7"><span offset-key="63fc815e15684d76a81cbba80c9e27c7:0">Use </span></span><a href="https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a324519a02164475b69f0c5f6681430a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="6ffd52de2c6c487c8834539cebdd4bca"><span data-offset-key="6ffd52de2c6c487c8834539cebdd4bca:0">Lighthouse</span></span></span></a><span key="0d94dcb751264165a5668fc03b0b5a9a"><span offset-key="0d94dcb751264165a5668fc03b0b5a9a:0">, </span></span><a href="https://www.deque.com/axe/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e6dbc25b2acc46b48b9d61c520c79ecc" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="d51c7d5068934b4caf53361b49549120"><span data-offset-key="d51c7d5068934b4caf53361b49549120:0">axe</span></span></span></a><span key="97e840c8e8ac4ae0bb75b0f82509707b"><span offset-key="97e840c8e8ac4ae0bb75b0f82509707b:0"> or </span></span><a href="https://accessibilityinsights.io" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f93ff52349014be49aa6dfef685eeaa1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="de0243ed99a845f0b60878944b0c3092"><span data-offset-key="de0243ed99a845f0b60878944b0c3092:0">Accessibility Insights</span></span></span></a><span key="89fb263faf71471abfb780ba639e53b2"><span offset-key="89fb263faf71471abfb780ba639e53b2:0"> to find and fix common accessibility issues in development</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d0bf6725479a461fb04731f44b8bd7c9"><span offset-key="d0bf6725479a461fb04731f44b8bd7c9:0">Test for </span></span><a href="https://dequeuniversity.com/tips/color-contrast" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7a1034007c2b499a89438c86cbcefbdb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="e146f8412cf14c13955b8ee12a3b0b25"><span data-offset-key="e146f8412cf14c13955b8ee12a3b0b25:0">adequate color contrast</span></span></span></a><span key="32d0c9117d6e4191b9950287027a0cd5"><span offset-key="32d0c9117d6e4191b9950287027a0cd5:0"> with the </span></span><a href="https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/01/devtools#contrast" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="38cade534fe24540806e1b5715db8069" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="73a7b8ebb52e49689d959c2f5a0f8a28"><span data-offset-key="73a7b8ebb52e49689d959c2f5a0f8a28:0">accessibility color picker in Chrome Developer Tools</span></span></span></a><span key="38f922d990d34c99be66a68feaaf3261"><span offset-key="38f922d990d34c99be66a68feaaf3261:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9cf7488057744089b533418e4fd42630"><span offset-key="9cf7488057744089b533418e4fd42630:0">Create inclusive and </span></span><a href="https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/building-a-contact-form#creating-an-accessible-form" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3427e3bf81a04f0189c2dadb2e8261b7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-6789_262-6790-240__"><span data-key="f59488f6e6754251814d3cafa7967c82"><span data-offset-key="f59488f6e6754251814d3cafa7967c82:0">accessible forms</span></span></span></a><span key="b81711a609df4632a2be3388ed62c66f"><span offset-key="b81711a609df4632a2be3388ed62c66f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>
